intro: Rubus × subvelutinus, commonly known as the bramble or blackberry bush, is a hybrid species within the Rubus genus. It is characterized by its thorny stems and aggregate fruits, which are typically dark purple to black in color. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by the development of its edible berries. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland edges or disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it a common species in both wild and cultivated settings.
